meanings.definition: To be extremely surprised or shocked.
meanings.sent1: I was flabbergasted by the unexpected news.
meanings.sent2: She flabbergasted everyone with her incredible magic trick.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog left everyone flabbergasted at the talent show.
meanings.sent4: The sudden thunderstorm flabbergasted the picnic attendees.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the double rainbow left me utterly flabbergasted.

meanings.sent1: The students were flabbergasted by the teacher's generosity.
meanings.sent2: He flabbergasted his friends with his exceptional singing skills.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ability to play the piano left the audience flabbergasted.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunrise flabbergasted the early risers.
meanings.sent5: The intricate sandcastle construction left the children flabbergasted.
